intro: Rhoicissus sekhukhuniensis, commonly known as the Sekhukhune vine, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Vitaceae family, which includes grapes and other climbing plants. The plant is characterized by its tendrils and heart-shaped leaves, which are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. This species is adapted to grow in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its resilience to harsh conditions.
